Package com.rapidminer.belt.table

Class MixedRowWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.table.MixedRowWriter
  • public final class MixedRowWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Writer to create a Table from row-wise data.
    Author:
    Gisa Meier
    See Also:
    Buffers

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves the reader to the next row.

      • set

        public void set​(int index,
                double value)
        Sets the value at the given column index for a numeric column. This method is well-defined for indices zero (including) to width() (excluding). For non-numeric columns use set(int, Object) instead.

        This method does not perform any range checks. Nor does it ever advance the current row. Before invoking this method, you will have to call move() at least once.

        Parameters:
        index - the column index of a numeric column
        value - the value to set

      • set

        public void set​(int index,
                java.lang.Object value)
        Sets the value at the given column index for a non-numeric column. This method is well-defined for indices zero (including) to width() (excluding). For numeric columns use set(int, double) instead.

        This method does not perform any range checks. Nor does it ever advance the current row. Before invoking this method, you will have to call move() at least once.

        Parameters:
        index - the column index of a non-numeric column
        value - the value to set

      • create

        public Table create()
        Creates a Table from the data inside the row writer. The row writer cannot be changed afterwards.
        Returns:
        a new table
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the stored column labels are not valid to create a table

      • width

        public int width()
        Returns:
        the number of values per row

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
